title: Chukzy1992
author: Chukzy1992
content: Nigeria is regarded as one of the fastest developing nations in Africa, nigeria ranks 144th most corrupt country in the 180 countries listed in the transparency International corruption index.     There is no doubt, there are problems or challenges facing the nigeria politics.(1)GODFATHERISM Godfathers are political sponsors who uses money and influence to win election for there preferable candidates.Godfathers are those who have been in the system(politics)for years, they can manipulate results and appoints candidates they want into political positions.When this candidates get into power they can't be free taking decisions on there own, except those ones that will eventually breaks out.A solution to this problem that policies should be put in place to ensures transparent election so as to put godfathers useless.(2)CORRUPTION Corruptions remains a problem in nigeria and also politics as well, and it is also global, causes of corruption are;*greed *tribalism *nepotism, corruption is in facts not only political problems, it also takes place in the society, economy, churches, place of work etc.(3)TRIBALISM Tribalism has been the cause of war, electoral malpractice, political instability in nigeria, citizens loose there sense of reasoning and vote person into power not considering if he or she is capable of leadership, they do it because of tribalism sentiment.etc In conclusion corruption have started since before we are born, but just that it is getting out of hand, we know it is not easy to fight it, but we are calling on the government to give a good example and a good leadership, and also enforce a law to face when you are a victim...

I wished there was a way to restrict those people without being accused of attacking the freedom of speech.Nigeria is fighting terrorism not only in the Eastern part but also in the Northern and Western parts of the country. The terrorism In the East is a product of the struggle for political power and the rise of secessionist groups that are seeking independence from Nigeria. The terrorist in the North are members of Boko Haram and ISIS West Africa. The terrorist in the Western part of the country are militias that were chased out of Libya during the civil war and most of them moved to Nigeria pretending to be herdsmen. The Nigerian military has the capacity and military might to put an end to these internal conflicts and external aggression but because some corrupt highly placed government and military officials are gaining financially from these conflicts, that is why it has lingered for many years. As @op rightly pointed out tribalism has also contributed to the escalation of these conflicts. It is believed in some quarters that the president is sympathetic to these terrorists terrorizing the western and northern parts of the country because they are from his tribe.

comments.author: alexkut987
comments.body: To address these challenges, it is important for Nigeria to implement measures that promote transparency and accountability in the electoral process. This can include measures such as the use of technology to enhance the credibility of the electoral process and the implementation of laws and regulations that promote free and fair elections.Similarly, to tackle corruption, Nigeria can introduce anti-corruption policies and measures to enhance accountability, such as strengthening the judiciary and law enforcement agencies to investigate and prosecute corrupt officials. Also, promoting transparency in government transactions and procurement can also help in reducing corruption.Finally, it's important to address tribalism in Nigeria. This can be achieved through promoting national unity and social cohesion, creating a sense of belonging and shared identity for all citizens irrespective of their ethnicity, and promoting equal opportunities for all Nigerians regardless of tribe or ethnicity.In conclusion, Nigeria needs to take proactive measures to tackle these challenges, through the implementation of policies and the promotion of strong institutions, to ensure a prosperous and stable future for the country.

comments.author: Ndabagi01
comments.body: You must be deeply disturbed by the way the Nigerian government handles political issues and how it affect the entire country. However, this is not limited to Nigeria; other African and developing countries face similar challenges. You've just mentioned three important factors that cause a democratically elected government to fail, even if they've been practicing it for a long time or have the resources to do practice it fairly to their citizens. Most citizens can only hope for a better nation, but their prayers will go unanswered unless they stand up and fight for themselves. Nigeria and every other nation facing political problems will one day stand up and fight against all injustice, and that day you’ll all feel a new freedom.
